trans-unit.source: Monitor usage in Windows Store and Phone apps with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Monitor usage in Windows Store and Phone apps with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Analyze usage of your Windows device app with Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Analyze usage of your Windows device app with Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Monitor usage in Windows Store and Windows Phone apps with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Monitor usage in Windows Store and Windows Phone apps with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Application Insights is in preview.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights is in preview.

trans-unit.source: Learn how many users you have, and which pages they're looking at in your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how many users you have, and which pages they're looking at in your app.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights provides you with that data out of the box.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights provides you with that data out of the box.

trans-unit.source: And by inserting a few lines of code in your app, you can learn more about the paths users take through your app and what they achieve with it.
trans-unit.target: And by inserting a few lines of code in your app, you can learn more about the paths users take through your app and what they achieve with it.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't done this already, add [Application Insights to your app project][windows], and republish it.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't done this already, add [Application Insights to your app project][windows], and republish it.

trans-unit.source: Track usage
trans-unit.target: Track usage

trans-unit.source: From the Overview timeline, click through Users and Sessions charts to see more detailed analytics.
trans-unit.target: From the Overview timeline, click through Users and Sessions charts to see more detailed analytics.

trans-unit.source: **Users** are tracked anonymously, so the same user on different devices would be counted twice.
trans-unit.target: **Users** are tracked anonymously, so the same user on different devices would be counted twice.

trans-unit.source: A **session** is counted when the app is suspended (for more than a brief interval, to avoid counting accidental suspensions).
trans-unit.target: A **session** is counted when the app is suspended (for more than a brief interval, to avoid counting accidental suspensions).

trans-unit.source: Segmentation
trans-unit.target: Segmentation

trans-unit.source: Segment a chart to get a breakdown by a variety of criteria.
trans-unit.target: Segment a chart to get a breakdown by a variety of criteria.

trans-unit.source: For example, to see how many users are using each version of your app, open the Users chart and segment by Application Version:
trans-unit.target: For example, to see how many users are using each version of your app, open the Users chart and segment by Application Version:

trans-unit.source: On the users chart, switch on Segmenting and choose Application version
trans-unit.target: On the users chart, switch on Segmenting and choose Application version

trans-unit.source: Page views
trans-unit.target: Page views

trans-unit.source: To discover the paths that users follow through your app, insert [page view telemetry][api] into your code:
trans-unit.target: To discover the paths that users follow through your app, insert [page view telemetry][api] into your code:

trans-unit.source: See the results on the page views chart, and by opening its details:
trans-unit.target: See the results on the page views chart, and by opening its details:

trans-unit.source: Click through any page to see the details of specific occurrences.
trans-unit.target: Click through any page to see the details of specific occurrences.

trans-unit.source: Custom events
trans-unit.target: Custom events

trans-unit.source: By inserting code to send custom events from your app, you can track your users' behavior and the usage of specific features and scenarios.
trans-unit.target: By inserting code to send custom events from your app, you can track your users' behavior and the usage of specific features and scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The data will appear in the Custom Events grid.
trans-unit.target: The data will appear in the Custom Events grid.

trans-unit.source: You can either see an aggregated view in Metrics Explorer, or click through any event to see specific occurrences.
trans-unit.target: You can either see an aggregated view in Metrics Explorer, or click through any event to see specific occurrences.

trans-unit.source: You can add string and numeric properties to any event.
trans-unit.target: You can add string and numeric properties to any event.

trans-unit.source: Click through any occurrence to see its detailed properties, including those you have defined.
trans-unit.target: Click through any occurrence to see its detailed properties, including those you have defined.

trans-unit.source: See [API reference][api] for more about custom events.
trans-unit.target: See [API reference][api] for more about custom events.

trans-unit.source: Sessions
trans-unit.target: Sessions

trans-unit.source: Session is a fundamental concept in Application Insights, which strives to associate every telemetry event - such as crashes or custom events that you code yourself - with a specific user session.
trans-unit.target: Session is a fundamental concept in Application Insights, which strives to associate every telemetry event - such as crashes or custom events that you code yourself - with a specific user session.

trans-unit.source: Rich context information is collected about each session, such as device characteristics, geo location, operating system, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Rich context information is collected about each session, such as device characteristics, geo location, operating system, and so on.

trans-unit.source: When [diagnosing problems][diagnostic], you can find all the telemetry related to the session in which a problem occurred, including all requests, and any events, exceptions or traces that were logged.
trans-unit.target: When [diagnosing problems][diagnostic], you can find all the telemetry related to the session in which a problem occurred, including all requests, and any events, exceptions or traces that were logged.

trans-unit.source: Sessions provide a good measure of the popularity of contexts such as device, operating system or location.
trans-unit.target: Sessions provide a good measure of the popularity of contexts such as device, operating system or location.

trans-unit.source: By showing the count of sessions grouped by device, for example, you get a more accurate count of how often that device is used with your app, than by counting page views.
trans-unit.target: By showing the count of sessions grouped by device, for example, you get a more accurate count of how often that device is used with your app, than by counting page views.

trans-unit.source: This would be a useful input to triage of any device-specific issue.
trans-unit.target: This would be a useful input to triage of any device-specific issue.

trans-unit.source: What's a session?
trans-unit.target: What's a session?

trans-unit.source: A session represents a single encounter between the user and the app.
trans-unit.target: A session represents a single encounter between the user and the app.

trans-unit.source: In its simplest form, session starts with a user launching the app and finishes when user leaves the app.
trans-unit.target: In its simplest form, session starts with a user launching the app and finishes when user leaves the app.

trans-unit.source: For mobile apps, the session is terminated when the app is suspended (moved to background) for more than 20 seconds.
trans-unit.target: For mobile apps, the session is terminated when the app is suspended (moved to background) for more than 20 seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the app is resumed, a new session will start.
trans-unit.target: If the app is resumed, a new session will start.

trans-unit.source: Naturally, a user may have multiple sessions in a day, or even in a single hour.
trans-unit.target: Naturally, a user may have multiple sessions in a day, or even in a single hour.

trans-unit.source: **Session duration** is a metric that represents the span of time between the first and last telemetry items of the session.
trans-unit.target: **Session duration** is a metric that represents the span of time between the first and last telemetry items of the session.

trans-unit.source: (It doesn't include the timeout period.)
trans-unit.target: (It doesn't include the timeout period.)

trans-unit.source: **Session count** in a certain interval is defined as the number of unique sessions with some activity during this interval.
trans-unit.target: **Session count** in a certain interval is defined as the number of unique sessions with some activity during this interval.

trans-unit.source: When you look at a long time range such as daily session count for the past week, this is usually equivalent to the total number of sessions.
trans-unit.target: When you look at a long time range such as daily session count for the past week, this is usually equivalent to the total number of sessions.

trans-unit.source: However, when you explore shorter time ranges such as hourly grain, a long session spanning multiple hours will be counted for each hour in which the session was active.
trans-unit.target: However, when you explore shorter time ranges such as hourly grain, a long session spanning multiple hours will be counted for each hour in which the session was active.

trans-unit.source: Users and user counts
trans-unit.target: Users and user counts

trans-unit.source: Each user session is associated with a unique user id, generated on the app's use and kept in device local storage.
trans-unit.target: Each user session is associated with a unique user id, generated on the app's use and kept in device local storage.

trans-unit.source: A user who uses multiple devices will be counted more than once.
trans-unit.target: A user who uses multiple devices will be counted more than once.

trans-unit.source: The **user count** metric in a certain interval is defined as the number of unique users with recorded activity during this interval.
trans-unit.target: The **user count** metric in a certain interval is defined as the number of unique users with recorded activity during this interval.

trans-unit.source: As a result, users with long sessions may be accounted multiple times, when you set a time range so that the grain is less than an hour or so.
trans-unit.target: As a result, users with long sessions may be accounted multiple times, when you set a time range so that the grain is less than an hour or so.

trans-unit.source: **New Users** counts the users whose first sessions with the app occurred during this interval.
trans-unit.target: **New Users** counts the users whose first sessions with the app occurred during this interval.

trans-unit.source: Debug vs Release mode
trans-unit.target: Debug vs Release mode

trans-unit.source: Debug
trans-unit.target: Debug

trans-unit.source: If you build in debug mode, events are sent as soon as they are generated.
trans-unit.target: If you build in debug mode, events are sent as soon as they are generated.

trans-unit.source: If you lose internet connectivity and then exit the app before regaining connectivity, offline telemetry is discarded.
trans-unit.target: If you lose internet connectivity and then exit the app before regaining connectivity, offline telemetry is discarded.

trans-unit.source: Release
trans-unit.target: Release

trans-unit.source: If you build in release configuration, events are stored in the device and sent when the application resumes.
trans-unit.target: If you build in release configuration, events are stored in the device and sent when the application resumes.

trans-unit.source: Data is also sent on the application's first use.
trans-unit.target: Data is also sent on the application's first use.

trans-unit.source: If there is no internet connectivity upon startup, previous telemetry as well as telemetry for the current lifecycle is stored and sent on the next resume.
trans-unit.target: If there is no internet connectivity upon startup, previous telemetry as well as telemetry for the current lifecycle is stored and sent on the next resume.
